title: Drawing, "Design for brooch and pins", 1825–50
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash on cream wove paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Large brooch: a cross is formed by four round diamonds, the central one being bigger and framed by a circle of diamonds, from it spring drapery festoons formed by diamonds. Smaller brooches are shaped like handles; left one with two leaves and a blossom, right one with a blossom, a leaf and a knot.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for brooch and pins", 1825–50.
1825–50. Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash on cream wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-5379.
